about_the_game:
This game will be released in chapters. The first chapter (and game) is available for $0.99.
Each subsequent chapter will be released as a DLC for this game for $0.99 as well.
There are no plans for pre-purchasing chapters at this time.

This game is rendered in 966 x 699 simply as a bizarre creative choice.

This game contains sequences of flashing imagery that may be problematic for some players. This can be disabled in the options.

Let's see... how did it go again...


For as long as there have been tongues to speak, people have spoken of HEAVEN. A perfect place. Far above us all.
For almost as long, (although perhaps not quite as long) people have spoken of another tale, related to the PARADISE above.
A piece of heaven fell, fell onto a hill below the sky. It shines, you see it even now, don't you?
Since that piece of HEAVEN fell, none with eyes to see have seen the top of that hill.
And every single one of them... has longed to.

You long for it too... don't you.

This world is strange.


It's magical, surreal, quite mysterious at times. Difficult to understand, don't you think?
Perhaps... perhaps we aren't quite meant to understand it all. That's ok I think.
Just so long as we know what we need to, what we really really want to, that's what counts I think.
Sure is fun to ponder though, even if not everything is 'solved'.

This world is fun.


You might get some new abilities once you're there. Heck, you might HAVE to.
Might make some new friends too! And some... "friends"... legally anyway.

With those abilities, you can do all sorts of magical things. But you might have to switch forms to use some abilities.
Joy, Rage, Sadness... there's power in the emotions. Different powers in each. You have strong feelings, I know. You can use them!

New pals can bring all sorts of things to the table. Aside from helping you in battle, they'll probably have special abilities for puzzle solving too!
It's always nice to have a friend who can help you solve puzzles. You've done that for me I know.

This world is hard.


Lots of things can... kill... you...
Even if you have a way to avoid death, you still can't just fight everything.
Not everything will be told to you so easily either.
And even if you do find a way to "save", you won't be able to do it whenever you want to. And the statues you use
won't always be super easy to get to.

Or maybe I'm just overthinking it... you're always stronger than I think you are haha.
But there was that one time I overestimated you too...
Well, I guess we'll just have to see, won't we?
Well... you will anyways.

This world is dark.


Like- very, very dark... sometimes...
I know you think you know but... you don't REALLY know yet. I might not even.
And some people have seen the worst of it... you know?
You might see the worst of it yourself... depending on what happens...
Promise me you'll stay strong, won't you?

content_descriptors.notes:
Things can die, and you can be responsible, whether you keep your hands technically clean or not.
This game is a psychological horror at times, and may be disturbing for some players.
Some characters may have disturbing imagery in their sprite-work, even mild gore, however it is clearly distinguishable from reality.
Words like "damn" and "he double hockey sticks" are used semi-frequently in the game.

The games themes and ideas are generally best digested by a more mature audience.  BEST digested, anyways; at least in my opinion.

name: Clossure

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Microsoft Windows 8.1 (32bit/64bit)
  • Processor: Intel N4100 (or similar) or better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX 9/OpenGL 4.1 capable GPU
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: A functioning keyboard is highly recommended.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Microsoft Windows 10 (32bit/64bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-6100 or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL ES 2.0 hardware driver support required for WebGL acceleration
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: A pair of headphones may enhance the experience, but a functioning monitor may be a higher priority for your experience.

short_description: I know, it should be one "s". I don't mind. In a surreal and mysterious world, a piece of heaven fell onto a hill below the sky. Since that day, none have seen the top of that hill, even though all have longed to. You intend to change that... don't you? This is a top down pixel art rpg.
